item.title: Tess add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Tess add a quote by Anne McCaffrey
item.description: "Oh, Tongue, give sound to joy and sing Of hope and promise on dragonwing" -- Anne McCaffrey

item.title: Tess add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Tess add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Tess add a quote by Tori Amos
item.description:
"On bad days I talk to Death constantly, not about suicide because honestly that's not dramatic enough. Most of us love the stage and suicide is definitely your last performance and being addicted to the stage, suicide was never an option - plus people get to look you over and stare at your fatty bits and you can't cross your legs to give that flattering thigh angle and that's depressing. So we talk. She says things no one else seems to come up with, like let's have a hotdog and then it's like nothing's impossible.
She told me once there is a part of her in everyone, though Neil believes I'm more Delirium than Tori, and Death taught me to accept that, you know, wear your butterflies with pride. And when I do accept that, I know Death is somewhere inside of me. She was the kind of girl all the girls wanted to be, I believe, because of her acceptance of "what is." She keeps reminding me there is change in the "what is" but change cannot be made till you accept the "what is." -- Tori Amos

item.title: Tess add a quote by Rudyard Kipling
item.description: "If you can walk with the crowd and keep your virtue, or walk with Kings-nor lose the common touch; If neither foes nor loving friends can hurt you; If all men count with you, but none too much; If you can fill the unforgiving minute with 60 seconds worth of distance run- Yours is the earth and everything that's in it, And-which is more-you'll be a man my son." -- Rudyard Kipling

item.title: Tess add a quote by Anne McCaffrey
item.description: "A good story is a good story no matter who wrote it." -- Anne McCaffrey

item.title: Tess add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "We know what we are, but not what we may be." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tess add a quote by Anne Bishop
item.description: "Everything has a price." -- Anne Bishop

item.title: Tess add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The road must be trod, but it will be very hard. And neither strength nor wisdom will carry us far upon it. This quest may be attempted by the weak with as much hope as the strong. Yet it is oft the course of deeds that move the wheels of the world: Small hands do them because they must, while the eyes of the great are elsewhere." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tess add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tess add a quote by Walt Whitman
Tess add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "If you look for the bad in people expecting to find it, you surely will." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Tess add a quote by Anne McCaffrey
item.description: "Who wills, Can. Who tries, Does. Who loves, Lives." -- Anne McCaffrey

item.title: Tess add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Tess add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Tess add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tess add a quote by Margaret Wise Brown
item.description: "Once there was a little bunny who wanted to run away. So he said to his mother, "I am running away". "If you run away", said his mother, "I will run after you. For you are my little bunny"." -- Margaret Wise Brown

item.title: Tess add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "If you are allergic to a thing, it is best not to put that thing in your mouth, particularly if the thing is cats." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Tess add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Reading is one form of escape. Running for your life is another." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Tess add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The Road goes ever on and on Down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, And I must follow, if I can, Pursuing it with eager feet, Until it joins some larger way Where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tess add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It's a dangerous business, Frodo, going out your door. You step onto the road, and if you don't keep your feet, there's no knowing where you might be swept off to." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tess add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tess add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tess add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It is not our part to master all the tides of the world, but to do what is in us for the succour of those years wherein we are set, uprooting the evil in the fields that we know, so that those who live after may have clean earth to till. What weather they shall have is not ours to rule." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tess add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "My dear Frodo!’ exclaimed Gandalf. ‘Hobbits really are amazing creatures, as I have said before. You can learn all that there is to know about their ways in a month, and yet after a hundred years they can still surprise you at a pinch." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Tess add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Everybody is identical in their secret unspoken belief that way deep down they are different from everyone else." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Tess add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tess add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Eating and reading are two pleasures that combine admirably." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Tess add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will." -- Charlotte Brontë
